ingredients: 4 cups sweet potatoes, peeled and cubed
instructions: In a large pot, boil the sweet potatoes until tender, about 15-20 minutes. Drain and mash them in a large bowl.
Add brown sugar, milk, melted butter, vanilla extract, cinnamon, nutmeg, and salt to the mashed sweet potatoes. Mix until smooth and well combined.
Transfer the sweet potato mixture to a greased 9x13 inch baking dish. Spread evenly.
In a separate bowl, combine chopped pecans, flour, granulated sugar, and remaining melted butter. Mix until crumbly.
Sprinkle the pecan mixture over the sweet potato layer, followed by a layer of mini marshmallows. Bake for 25-30 minutes, until the marshmallows are golden brown.
tips: To achieve the perfect sweet potato casserole, ensure your sweet potatoes are fully cooked and tender before mashing. For maximum flavor, use fresh spices rather than pre-ground ones. Avoid overmixing the sweet potato mixture to keep it fluffy. Store leftovers in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 3 days. When making sweet potato casserole, the main ingredient is, of course, sweet potatoes. Look for firm, smooth-skinned potatoes for the best flavor and texture. note.content:
• Temperature precision: Bake at 350¬∞F (175¬∞C) for the best results; this ensures even cooking and prevents burning.

note.label: Pro Chef Secrets
note.content:
• Restaurant technique: For an extra layer of flavor, roast the sweet potatoes instead of boiling them. This caramelizes their natural sugars and enhances the dish's sweetness.
  • Ingredient prep secret: Always bring your butter to room temperature before mixing; this ensures a smooth blend into the sweet potato mixture.
  • Timing strategy: Prepare the sweet potato mixture a day in advance and store it in the fridge. This allows the flavors to meld beautifully.
  • Presentation hack: For a professional touch, use a piping bag to create decorative swirls of marshmallows on top before baking.
